channel.title: Ideas?
channel.description:
Hi, I am creating a new server. I am planning on going big. But I am still in some problems. There 2 different type of servers and it`s hard to choose the perfect one. I have described two types. Please help me to choose one.
[OLD-SCHOOL] Economy based, few awesome custom maps. Unique features and quests. A story lines which gives curiosity to the player. All skills
[NEW-SCHOOL] New data (Only 602 anims, npc, items). Unique features and quests. Allot of bosses (Because of newer npcs)
Please choose and vote. Prove your answer too and give suggsestions.

item.title: Ideas?
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“artem543, post:17, topic:439253”][quote author=Loveandpower link=topic=541954.msg3970937#msg3970937 date=1334144530]
Give items unique effects and you will be okay with either one
[/quote]
I think people want more than just unique effects and items…[/quote]obviously there will be more but you have to consider several factors

  1. how old will your players be?

this is important because every age group thinks about different items when they look at a server.

  1. Is your server stable?

People hate lag, not sure why but they don’t like it a stable server is a highly played one.(or that should be the norm )

  1. Does it look appealing to the eye?

Just like with a business, the media and the outside appearance matters.

Read full topic

item.title: Ideas?
item.dc:creator: @chillwitm888 chillwitm888
item.description:
@chillwitm888 wrote:

What YOU want
because think of it this way
new school: More Noobs signed up than ever during 600+
old school: 4-5thousand most and thats pushing it 194+
So majority of rs is more familiar with 600’s
But u can tri making a rs-2007-6-4-3-
and spam rs----06 for more players…BETA 4 phr33
vault deserves this

Read full topic

item.description:

Give items unique effects and you will be okay with either one

item.title: Ideas?
item.dc:creator: @Daginith Daginith
item.description:
@Daginith wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:14, topic:439253”]People don’t want copies, they want innovation.

For example, when a company brings something new to the table, something that the people didn’t realize they wanted/needed, they gain a significant portion of the market share.[/quote]

Ok…then use what made dodian so successful.

I fucking loved that server.
So sad the last day it was up

Read full topic

item.title: Ideas?
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

People don’t want copies, they want innovation.

For example, when a company brings something new to the table, something that the people didn’t realize they wanted/needed, they gain a significant portion of the market share.

Read full topic

item.title: Ideas?
item.dc:creator: @Daginith Daginith
item.description:
@Daginith wrote:

[quote=“reyx7, post:7, topic:439253”]The only way to be successful is to be a hipster. Avoid mainstream servers. I haven’t touched servers for about a year, but when I did all-star and delta were the things to “leech”. Until your skills and execution of Java can be amazing to were you can successfully not only create your own content but your own, completely original concepts, your server will fail.

There is a list of over 100 things a server shouldn’t have (the topic exists but is locked). Some general things to avoid

-massive xp amount
If you’re going to make 99 easy, then just start out max
-click teleporting
Bad. Bad.
-fuckton of customs
If they’re original and helpful to the server, ok. But you do not need 500 variations of a veracs brassy
-large Map
Unless you truely have content at every single part of the map, keep in a small contained area. Dodian was a rather successful server and it was in 1 small town.

I could go on, but I think I’ve made a point. Not to be rude or anything either, but your server will probably fail. It’s just at that point.[/quote]
Dodian <3

Just copy what they did, you will be successful.

Read full topic

item.title: Ideas?
item.dc:creator: @kronixz kronikz
item.description:
@kronixz wrote:

When you mean new… Do you mean a high revision, or just a stupid PI…
If high revision I say new, if not defianetly go old school.

Read full topic

item.title: Ideas?
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Then you will fail. You can’t look outside yourself for motivation. People could keep tellingy ou to go for it, but unless you want to, and unless you’re dedicated to getting it done, you’re not going to get anywhere.

Read full topic

item.title: Ideas?
item.dc:creator: @artem543 artem543
item.description:
@artem543 wrote:

[quote=“reyx7, post:7, topic:439253”]The only way to be successful is to be a hipster. Avoid mainstream servers. I haven’t touched servers for about a year, but when I did all-star and delta were the things to “leech”. Until your skills and execution of Java can be amazing to were you can successfully not only create your own content but your own, completely original concepts, your server will fail.

There is a list of over 100 things a server shouldn’t have (the topic exists but is locked). Some general things to avoid

-massive xp amount
If you’re going to make 99 easy, then just start out max
-click teleporting
Bad. Bad.
-fuckton of customs
If they’re original and helpful to the server, ok. But you do not need 500 variations of a veracs brassy
-large Map
Unless you truely have content at every single part of the map, keep in a small contained area. Dodian was a rather successful server and it was in 1 small town.

I could go on, but I think I’ve made a point. Not to be rude or anything either, but your server will probably fail. It’s just at that point.[/quote]
Very helpful. It wont fail I know what i am doing but i just need motivation.

Read full topic

item.title: Ideas?
item.dc:creator: @ezzi ezzi
item.description:
@ezzi wrote:

Old school, to many kids nowadays are going " OHHEMMGEEEE HYBRIDPVP HAS NEW GFX AND ITEMS OMG" when they should be doing that over the older looking things like hyperion or something so… Old school
Perhaps hyperion ;D

item.title: Ideas?
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Do what you like best. If you don’t like 508+, you’re not going to like developing one.

item.title: Ideas?
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

The only way to be successful is to be a hipster. Avoid mainstream servers. I haven’t touched servers for about a year, but when I did all-star and delta were the things to “leech”. Until your skills and execution of Java can be amazing to were you can successfully not only create your own content but your own, completely original concepts, your server will fail.

There is a list of over 100 things a server shouldn’t have (the topic exists but is locked). Some general things to avoid

-massive xp amount
If you’re going to make 99 easy, then just start out max
-click teleporting
Bad. Bad.
-fuckton of customs
If they’re original and helpful to the server, ok. But you do not need 500 variations of a veracs brassy
-large Map
Unless you truely have content at every single part of the map, keep in a small contained area. Dodian was a rather successful server and it was in 1 small town.

I could go on, but I think I’ve made a point. Not to be rude or anything either, but your server will probably fail. It’s just at that point.

Read full topic

item.title: Ideas?
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

You could (and probably should) add a poll for this so you can see the results in a percentage.
I like the old-school idea better. Don’t make another ‘602-anim/npc/map/everything-else’ shit, keep the cache small, the server simple, and of course the server unique and fun.

Read full topic

item.title: Ideas?
item.dc:creator: @b00mz1029 b00mz1029
item.description:
@b00mz1029 wrote:

Players are starting to enjoy the older runescape nowadays and are leaning more towards the 317 old gfx idea. Go oldschool!
